meaning: The basic building block of all living organisms
A group of cells with a similar structure and function
Tissues grouped together to perform a specific function
A group of organs that work together to form organisms
An organ system where organs work together to digest and absorb food
A biological catalyst that increases the rate of reactions in organisms
A model that represents the way that the active site of an enzyme must be the exact shape of a substrate
An type of carbohydrase that breaks down carbohydrates into starch. It is produced in salivary glands and the pancreas
An enzyme that breaks down proteins into amino acids. It is produced in the stomach and pancreas
An enzyme that breaks down lipids (fats) into glycerol and fatty acids. It is produced in the pancreas
A type of enzyme that breaks down carbohydrates into simple sugars
An alkaline substance produced in the liver and stored in the gall bladder, which is used to neutralise stomach acid and emulsify fat
A group of cells in the right atrium that controls the resting heart rate
An organ that pumps blood around the body in a double circulatory system
A chamber of the heart which pumps blood to the lungs, where gas exchange takes place
A chamber of the heart which pumps blood to most of the body
An artery transporting oxygenated blood from the heart to the rest of the body
A vein transporting deoxygenated blood from the rest of the body to the heart
An artery transporting deoxygenated blood from the heart to the lungs
A vein transporting oxygenated blood from the lungs to the heart
A type of blood vessel which carries blood at high pressure away from the heart
A type of blood vessel which carries blood at low pressure towards the heart
A type of blood vessel which is very thin and is used for the exchange of substances
A tissue made up of plasma, in which platelets and red and white blood cells are suspended.
A disease caused by the buildup of fatty acids in coronary arteries, narrowing it and reducing blood flow to the heart
A metal tube which can be inserted into the body in order to keep coronary arteries open
A type of drug that reduces blood cholesterol levels
The state of physical and mental wellbeing
A non-communicable disease where cells grow and divide uncontrollably
A cell growth which is contained in one area and does not affect other parts of the body
A cancerous cell growth that can spread to other parts of the body through the blood
A tissue found in plants where cells are specialised to maximise the rate of photosynthesis
A tissue found in plants that is specialised for the exchange of gases
A structure found in plants which is made of dead cells and transports water and dissolved mineral ions from the roots to the leaves
A structure found in plants which is made of living cells, and transports sugars from the source to the sink (which can be upwards or downwards)
